intro: Nycterisition ferrugineum, commonly known as the rust-colored nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive reddish-brown foliage and small, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces berries that contain toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Native to parts of Africa, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its unique appearance and chemical composition make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
